instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message:
this board has been worked on by someone else before, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> looks newer and they put a resistor between c7041and <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR>

magsafe green light comes on, but won't charge (no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>) unless i hook up a charged battery, then will actually power on. but won't power on with battery only
all current sense resistors look ok

i get 20ish ohms resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

adapter sense is 3.3V but looks like something keeps trying to pull it down to 3.15 when I check <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>

is it the ISL or something else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message: Check if there is actually a 6258 on there on not a 6259. Resistor between <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR>/41 is <RESISTOR>R7040</RESISTOR> I guess? If that all is ok then replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7040</RESISTOR> is still there also
is a 6258AHRTZ

i assume the ISL rework and everything was working until a shitty charger did something to bring it to where it is now

could the ISL gotten fried and everything else be fine?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message: Yes that is of course possible. Check <RESISTOR>R7040</RESISTOR> value against the schematic. Also check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message: replaced the ISL and now it's running off of AC but still no battery, everything else looks fine any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message: nope, doesn't see battery and BIL doesn't light up

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message:
maybe too much heat/time on ISL when I was putting it down?  Do you think I should try another one?

pins 17/18 still giving 21.1k resistance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message: even though it can run off of batt after i start it on AC? damn so close

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery issues
threads.message: Dont need BGA machine, it is a small chip ..... Use your hot air station and preheater if you have, hot air station is enough if you don't have preheater, practice in donor boards first ....
